From: Bhupinder Singh <bsingh@...>
Subject: Re: [cantera] Gaussian Impulse
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=228646714; y=eTA_adWpS_u8-ORU2SSZqfxsaC7rHwAJWlIYJJMjhtFyjC1P6RB31SHCq6Q
X-Yahoo-Profile: bhupindersingh_99

Hi,

I've been experiencing similar problem with the Gaussian pulse. 
Here's how my Gaussian function looks like..I've tried working on 
it but couldn't get the ignitor to work.I finally migrated to 
python and got things working. Below are a few tips that might 
help you just in case you want to try working on the problem in 
MATLAB.

-----------------------------
function f = Gaussian(t,A,t0, fwhm)


tau = fwhm/(2.0*sqrt(log(2.0)));
x = (t-t0)./tau;
f = A*exp(-x.*x);

-----------------------------
Here's how I created a functor in Matlab..for use in a CSTR..

igniter_mdot = @(t) Gaussian(t,1,0.02,0.2);

>> ignitor_mdot(0.5)

------------------------------

Reference:

%    class Gaussian(Func1):
%    """A Gaussian pulse. Instances of class 'Gaussian' evaluate
%    \f[
%    f(t) = A \exp[-(t - t_0) / \tau]
%    \f]
%    where
%    \f[
%    \tau = \frac{\mbox{FWHM}}{2.0\sqrt{\ln(2.0)}}
%    \f]
%    'FWHM' denotes the full width at half maximum.

%    As an example, here is how to create
%    a Gaussian pulse with peak amplitude 10.0, centered at time 
2.0,
%    with full-width at half max = 0.2:
%    >>> f = Gaussian(A = 10.0, t0 = 2.0, FWHM = 0.2)
%    >>> f(2.0)
%    ___10
%    >>> f(1.9)
%    ___5
%    >>> f(2.1)
%    ___5
%    """
 % class Gaussian : public Func1 {
 % public:
 % Gaussian(double A, double t0, double fwhm) {
 %            m_A = A;
 %           m_t0 = t0;
 %           m_tau = fwhm/(2.0*sqrt(log(2.0)));
 %       }
 %       virtual ~Gaussian() {}
 %       virtual doublereal eval(doublereal t) {
 %           doublereal x = (t - m_t0)/m_tau;
 %           return m_A*exp(-x*x);
 %       }
 %   protected:
 %       doublereal m_A, m_t0, m_tau;
 %   private:
 %   };

-----------------------------------


Hope that helps.

Bhupinder


On Mon Nov 28 17:18:38 EST 2005, rezvani_reza 
<rezvani_reza@...> wrote:

> I am trying to create a combustor model in Matlab. But I think 
> Cantera library in Matlab does not have Gaussian Impulse for 
> initial ignition of the mixture. Since I am not familiar with 
> Python and it does not have the plot capabilities of the Matlab 
> at the first place, I tried to build a Gaussian pulse object in 
> Matlab. Unfortunately I have not been able to do this so far. So 
> I was wondering if anyone is dealing with similar problem and has 
> a solution to it.
> Professor Goodwin:
> would you tell me what is the formula that you used for Gaussian 
> impulse in Python?
> 
> Thanks
